title: Cullen Viaduct Walk Route

nearby.description: Buckie to Findochty and Cullen Coastal Walk

images.title: Richard Bird / Cullen Viaduct
images.caption: Cullen Viaduct. Cullen Railway Station and line was recommended for closure by Dr Beeching's report "The Reshaping of British Railways" and closed on 6 May 1968.

images.title: Cullen Railway Viaduct by Alan Hodgson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cullen Railway Viaduct. A category B listed structure with eight arches, built to carry a single track, constructed in 1884.

images.title: Viaduct, Cullen by Richard Webb, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: On the Viaduct, Cullen. There's some nice views over the village from this elevated spot.

images.title: Moray Coast Railway by Richard Webb, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Moray Coast Railway

images.title: Cullen Railway Viaduct towers over the road bridge by Alan Hodgson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cullen Railway Viaduct towers over the road bridge

images.title: Looking West Over Cullen Railway Viaduct by Alan Hodgson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Looking West Over Cullen Railway Viaduct

images.title: Moray Coast Railway by Richard Webb, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Moray Coast Railway

images.title: Walkers at Cullen by Walter Baxter, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Walkers at Cullen

description: This walk takes you along the old Moray Firth coast line in Cullen. The disused railway line is now a pleasant cycling and walking trail that can be followed to nearby Portknockie. The flat multi user path runs for just over 1.5 miles, passing the photogenic Cullen Viaduct on the way. The impressive structure is one of the local highlights and often features in tourist guides and Scottish calendars. On the walk there's some excellent views of the surrounding coast and countryside. You can turn the linear route into a longer circular walk on the Cullen to Portknockie Walk which follows the Moray Coast Trail along Cullen Bay and Beach.
